election_record.label: New Jersey 1805 Secretary of State

overview.note: "On Wednesday afternoon agreeable to appointment the Two Houses went into Joint Meeting - James Cox, esq. in the chair. On proceeding to the appointment of a Secretary of State, the votes were ... Mr. Linn was of course declared duly elected." New-Jersey Journal (Elizabethtown, NJ). November 12, 1805.

"On Wednesday last another joint-meeting was held, and James Linn, Esq. made Secretary of State, vice Mr. Beatty, whose time of office had expired." The Centinel of Freedom (Newark, NJ). November 5, 1805.

election_record.reference: The Centinel of Freedom (Newark, NJ). November 5, 1805.
National Intelligencer and Washington Advertiser (Washington, DC). November 11, 1805.
